Race.SpecificTitle: Kingswood Improve Dist. -- $240.00 Annual Fee - BOC - 7 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
KINGSWOOD SUBDIVISION IMPROVEMENT DISTRICT PROPOSITION 

SUMMARY:  A SPECIAL ANNUAL FEE NOT TO EXCEED TWO HUNDRED FORTY DOLLARS ($240) FOR SEVEN (7) YEARS UPON EACH PARCEL OF TAXABLE REAL PROPERTY LOCATED WITHIN THE KINGSWOOD SUBDIVISION IMPROVEMENT DISTRICT TO PROMOTE AND ENCOURAGE THE BEAUTIFICATION, SECURITY AND OVERALL BETTERMENT OF THE KINGSWOOD SUBDIVISION IMPROVEMENT DISTRICT.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of New Orleans levy a special annual fee, to be called the Kingswood Subdivision Improvement District Fee, on each parcel of taxable real property within the Kingswood Subdivision Improvement District (which District is comprised of that area of the city of New Orleans located within the following boundaries: the I-10 Service Road, the west right-of-way line of the Kingswood Subdivision, the center line of the Morrison Canal, and the center line of the Vincent Canal, exclusive of any property zoned and used as commercial property) as specified by Resolution R-07-388 of the City Council of New Orleans in an amount not to exceed two hundred forty dollars ($240) annually for seven (7) years, beginning in 2008 and ending in 2014, which fee is estimated to generate approximately eighty-three thousand dollars ($83,000) annually, to be used solely and exclusively to promote and encourage the beautification, security and overall betterment of the Kingswood Subdivision Improvement District as determined and managed by the Board of Commissioners of the Kingswood Subdivision Improvement District which additional security shall be supplemental to and not in lieu of personnel and services provided in the District by the New Orleans Police Department?

Race.SpecificTitle: Hurst.Sec. Neigh.Imp.Dist -- Parcel Fee- BOC - 7 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
HURSTVILLE SECURITY AND NEIGHBORHOOD IMPROVEMENT DISTRICT
PROPOSITION

SUMMARY:  A SPECIAL FEE FOR SEVEN (7) YEARS UPON EACH IMPROVED PARCEL OF LAND IN THE HURSTVILLE SECURITY AND NEIGHBORHOOD IMPROVEMENT DISTRICT TO PROMOTE AND ENCOURAGE THE SECURITY, BEAUTIFICATION, AND OVERALL BETTERMENT OF THE HURSTVILLE SECURITY AND NEIGHBORHOOD IMPROVEMENT DISTRICT.
Race.FullText: Shall the city of New Orleans levy a special annual fee (except that no fee shall be imposed upon any parcel whose owner qualified for the special assessment level provided by Article VII, Section 18(G)(1) of the Louisiana Constitution), to be called the Hurstville Security and Neighborhood Improvement District Fee, on each improved parcel of land in the Hurstville Security and Neighborhood Improvement District (which district is comprised of that area of the city of New Orleans located within and including the following perimeter streets and avenues: Magazine Street (both sides) from Valmont Street to Nashville Avenue (downtown side only), to Hurst Street (river side only), to Arabella Street (downtown side only), to St. Charles Avenue (lake side only), including the parcel at the corner of the river side of St. Charles Avenue and the downtown side of Arabella Street, to Nashville Avenue (downtown side only), to Loyola Avenue (both sides), to Octavia Street (both sides), to Liberty Street (both sides), to Jefferson Avenue (uptown side only), to Prytania Street (excluding all municipal numbers in this portion of Prytania Street), to Valmont Street (both sides), to Magazine Street) as specified by Resolution R-07-379 of the City Council of New Orleans in an amount not to exceed five hundred dollars ($500) in 2008 and not to exceed five hundred dollars ($500) plus annual increases of twenty-five dollars ($25) for each year from 2009 through 2014, which fee is estimated to generate approximately three hundred seventy-five thousand dollars ($375,000) annually, to be used solely and exclusively to promote and encourage the security, beautification and overall betterment of the Hurstville Security and Neighborhood Improvement District as determined and managed by the Board of Commissioners of the Hurtsville Security and Neighborhood Improvement District, which additional security (public or private) or any other services or betterments provided by the District shall be supplemental to and not in lieu of personnel and services provided in the district by the state of Louisiana or the city of New Orleans or their departments or agencies or by other political subdivisions?
